nodes.title: MetaMask Extensionâ€™s updated UX elevates network, dapp, and account selection
nodes.subtitle: Learn about the walletâ€™s new look and how it provides a simpler web3 experience.

image.title: MM UI Updates â€“ No Annotations (Feature)

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Weâ€™re excited to unveil some changes to the MetaMask wallet extension with v10.33 that make it simpler, cleaner, and more intuitive to use than ever before.

You'll notice a crisper layout when you first open the fox head on your browser.

The two top rows which previously displayed wallet address, connection status, network selection, and account selection have now been condensed into a single top row, minimizing visual noise and giving you everything you need at a quick glance.

In addition, we've made site connections more obvious on the top right (check image below) so you can easily see and manage the dapps your MetaMask wallet is interacting with. This helps with granting permissions and knowing what youâ€™re connecting to.

To avoid confusing elementsâ€”yes, we heard you and went to workâ€”we separated the account selection from the global menu navigation and placed the account avatar right by the account name so you always have a clear visual association with your identity. This seemingly minor change has profound implications by increasing your awareness and confidence when interacting with dapps.

Finally, the network selector moved to the top left within the header and each network is now associated with its respective token. This unique pairing helps distinguish different chains from each other and promotes user safety.

At MetaMask, we encourage safe and secure web3 habits. We hope this new user experience makes your web3 journey more simple and enjoyable. This UX was inspired by user feedback, and we encourage you to keep telling us what you think! We take note. Remember, MetaMask Portfolio spun out from popular community request. ğŸ˜‰

Till next timeâ€¦

Happy browsing! ğŸŒğŸ¦Š

nodes.title: MetaMask and PayPal, all you need to know about buying ETH
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask is the first web3 wallet to allow U.S. users to buy ETH easily with PayPal.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMaskâ€™s buy crypto solution within the wallet makes purchasing Ethereum (ETH) and other currencies easy. Adding to the list of payment options, PayPal is available as a payment method for our users across the U.S. (excl. Hawaii).

MetaMask is the first web3 wallet to enable users to buy ETH using PayPal, a leader in the digital payment space. In addition to purchasing ETH directly, the integration also supports the transfer of ETH from PayPal to MetaMask, aiding in more self-custody adoption.



What is PayPal?


In addition to being one of the most popular digital payments providers, PayPal also offers cryptocurrency services on its platform. With this new integration, users will be able to use their PayPal balance, linked bank account, or debit card to add ETH to their MetaMask wallet directly.

How do I get started?


PayPalâ€™s U.S. users can now buy ETH in a handful of clicks. You will be prompted to sign up with PayPal if you donâ€™t currently have an account with them.

To add ETH to your MetaMask wallet with PayPal in the U.S.:

  1. Login into the MetaMask browser extension, mobile app, or MetaMask Portfolio. (If you havenâ€™t downloaded MetaMask yet, start here).
  2. Click or tap â€œBUYâ€ to get started.
  3. Select country (US only) and state (PayPalâ€™s crypto services are available in 49 states; not in Hawaii).
  4. Choose â€œPayPalâ€ as your payment method.
  5. Select ETH and enter the amount you want to buy (This is the only cryptocurrency currently available for purchase through PayPal on MetaMask).
  6. Sign in to your PayPal account.
  7. Select payment option of choice: PayPal balance, eligible bank, or debit card.
  8. Review purchase and click â€œConfirmâ€.
  9. Success!!! ğŸ¦Š Onto core web3 activities ğŸ¦Š

Itâ€™s that simple. PayPalâ€™s easy crypto purchasing solution allows you to enjoy your funds quickly, on the go. Ready to dive in?
